title: Issue with the validation_data with unsupervised and semi-supervised learning using generators
body:
**Task**

I am trying to obtain the validation loss of my model during the training (call to fit). We work with worms brain data, some of the volume are segmented.

**What have you tried**

For unsupervised, it works when we use arrays as input ("generator" similar to the one presented in the tutorial) and arrays as validation_data (homemade function, inspired by the generated mentioned above). It works but it's very slow and limited by the memory.

For semi-supervised and "unsupervised 2.0", we use the generator found in your repository (respectively semisupervised and volgen) for the x data but when we use the same generator for the validation_data, at the end of the first epoch, the fitting is stuck in an infinite loop or return val_loss equals to 0 at the end of each epoch. This also occurs when the semisupervised generator is called in a comprehension list in order to "convert it".

The training work just fine when the argument validation_data is left empty.

**Details of experiments**

We want to train semi-supervised with a mix of segmented (segmentation with integer values between 0 and 7) and non-segmented data (segmentation is array of zeros)
